docs.snippet: The intersection of personal and professional factors — along with the right players — made him the right person to lead the Yankees. On Saturday, the team will retire his number....
docs.lead_paragraph: The intersection of personal and professional factors — along with the right players — made him the right person to lead the Yankees. On Saturday, the team will retire his number.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column highlights New York Yankees revered manager Joe Torre, who led team to four titles during his tenure; notes that Torre with have his number retired and a plaque at Monument Park unveiled during ceremony at Yankees Stadium.

headline.main: Four Days That Inspired Torre’s Four Rings

docs.snippet: A matchup between the Taney Dragons of Philadelphia and Jackie Robinson West of Chicago bucked the trend in baseball, especially the pros, of fewer African-American players....
docs.lead_paragraph: A matchup between the Taney Dragons of Philadelphia and Jackie Robinson West of Chicago bucked the trend in baseball, especially the pros, of fewer African-American players.
docs.abstract: Chicago eliminates Philadelphia, 6-5, in Little League World Series, ending storybook run of Mo'ne Davis, who became a national figure of inspiration as first girl to pitch a shutout in the tournament; matchup between two predominantly black teams bucked trend in baseball, especially professional baseball, of fewer African-American players.

headline.main: Two Little League World Series Teams Buck Trend
headline.print_headline: As Black Participation Shrinks, 2 Teams Buck Trend
